pullRequest.title: HDDS-4179. Implement post-finalize SCM logic.
pullRequest.bodyText:
What changes were proposed in this pull request?
Implement post-finalize SCM logic to allow nodes of only new version to participate in pipelines.
What is the link to the Apache JIRA
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDDS-4179
How was this patch tested?
build UT. I will fix failures in CI.

nodes.bodyText: Can we also reset SCMSafeModeManager#setInSafeMode to true? In some scenarios, we alreadt use safemode status check to reject some create type operations for new containers/pipelines.
I don't see any usages for this.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -124,6 +124,7 @@ public ResultCodes getResult() {
     FAILED_TO_ALLOCATE_ENOUGH_BLOCKS,
     INTERNAL_ERROR,
     FAILED_TO_INIT_PIPELINE_CHOOSE_POLICY,
-    FAILED_TO_INIT_LEADER_CHOOSE_POLICY
+    FAILED_TO_INIT_LEADER_CHOOSE_POLICY,
+    FAILED_TO_FINALIZE_UPGRADE

nodes.bodyText:
Do we want to throw an exception here? The background pipeline creator will keep trying to create pipelines, and the logs may be filled with exceptions. Is there a way to do this more cleaner? Maybe something like
Stop pipeline creator --> Add flag in pipeline manager to stop createPipeline (for manual pipeline creation) -> Destroy existing pipelines
This may become a costly operation during finalize. If we have destroyed all pipelines, the containers are automatically closed. So, we maybe able to skip this.

What happens it this is invoked while the SCM (or OM) is being finalized? If it restarts, we may be OK with losing state, but how about the case when SCM is running & currently finalizing, and that time someone invokes finalize again?
Nit: as we statically import HEALTHY_READONLY, we can leave out the qualification of NodeState here, as we do in forceNodesToHealthyReadOnly
Aren't we want to do a noop when the action is not present?
